data.text:
The economy of Africa has become a well-established system over the course of many years. Early writers and historians may have said that Africa was nothing until Europeans arrived and helped the people of Africa make a so-called undeveloped country more civilized and adaptable. They also may say that the economic system established when Britain, Spain, and France in colonized Africa countries. Before these countries conquered over African nations, Africa had its type of economy throughout each region. Each kingdom that was in the areas of West, North, and East was able to establish their economic system that allowed the empires to flourish. Western Africa has developed into an adaptable area through many empires that have conquered this area. One of the most modern empires in this region was the Ghana Empire. Before the Ghana Empire, this particular area was known as the Sub-Saharan or also called black Africa. In this region, there was a vast amount of land that no one occupied until the Ghana Empire that was in between the Sahara Desert and North of the country of Africa. In the book "Ghana," the author states that "number of societies south of the Sahara, interaction with Eurasian cultures and opportunities for international exchange were important elements in their economic, social, political and cultural history ….” This statement from this book explains that West Africa was able to establish a trade route in this region that would become a significant factor in their economy. The Kush empire influences derived from Egyptian Empire that allowed this empire to achieve and make its type economy. Just like the Egyptians, the Kush empire wanted to be able to produce crops and to be able to trade with other countries. The idea of agriculture surrounded North region of Africa's economy. Northeast region of Africa could also be called the since it was near many rivers such as the Nile and Red Sea that would establish trade by sea to Europe. The geographical location of North Africa is around water, land, and forest. Since the north region was directly by water, it was easy to develop a system of agriculture. Farming was one of the first forms of work that used in starting many civilizations before becoming more advanced. In the agricultural sector, the people of North Africa would hunt and gather food by fishing in the rivers, wheat and barely were popular food to cultivate. Crops grew around these rivers such as rice and yams that the people would pick and manage.
